intro: Limonia australis, commonly known as the Australian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and ovate, with a glossy green surface. Limonia australis is well adapted to coastal and sandy soils, making it a resilient species in arid environments.
